snippet: Graduating seniors say that few are finding jobs, and that some offers extended over the winter are being rescinded, as the Chinese economy falters.
abstract: Record seven million students graduating from universities and colleges across China will face bleak job prospects in latest sign of troubled Chinese economy; government, fearing problem could affect social stability, orders schools, government agencies and state-owned enterprises to hire more graduates to help relieve joblessness.

byline.original: By KEITH BRADSHER and SUE-LIN WONG
byline.contributor: Keith Bradsher reported from Hong Kong and Sue-Lin Wong from Beijing. Chris Buckley contributed reporting from Hong Kong, and Mia Li contributed research from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: Graduating seniors say that few are finding jobs, and that some offers extended over the winter are being rescinded, as the Chinese economy falters.

headline.main: Faltering Economy in China Dims Job Prospects for Graduates
